thread.title: Kenyan police put Sh14m bounties on terror suspects
thread.title_full: Kenyan police put Sh14m bounties on terror suspects

title: Kenyan police put Sh14m bounties on terror suspects
text:
Kenyan police put Sh14m bounties on terror suspects Wednesday February 8 2017 Sharif Sheck Arab, who is among seven terror suspects wanted by police. PHOTO | COURTESY Advertisement More by this Author 
Police have released the names and photographs of seven men suspected of carrying out terror attacks in Mandera County. 
They are linked to the attack at Bisharo Lodge in October 2016, one at Jabane hotel in January and the raid at an Administration Police camp in Arabia, northern Kenya, on February 2. 
Police also placed a Sh2 million bounty on the head of each of the suspects. 
“The terrorists are believed to be operating between Kenya and Somalia. We urge the public to promptly report to the police should they see any of them. 
Abdullahi Issack Diyat, alias Ubeyd, and Ahmed Maalim Bashir, who are among seven terror suspects wanted by police. PHOTO | COURTESY 
“Whereas the threat of terror remains high national security agencies have taken necessary preventive measures,” said police spokesman George Kinoti. Related Content Police reservist killed in Mandera Shabaab attack - VIDEO 
He warned that the suspects are armed and dangerous. 
Idris Ismael Issack and Ahmed Mahat Mohamed, alias Jerry, who are suspected to be behind terror attacks in northern Kenya. PHOTO | COURTESY 
Andikari Haret Mohamed Yussuf Kuno alias Abu Ali and Mohamed who are among seven terror suspects wanted by police. PHOTO | COURTESY
